title: I have 2 months left for my 12th class. I wasted my 11th and I am a JEE Advanced aspirant. What should I do now in these 2 months to cover my whole syllabus of 11th? - Quora

response.answer_text: Same with me! I currently preparing for my boards.I wasted my class 11.I am thinking to complete class 11 portion in 2months vacation. To cover syllabus in 2 months you need work hard. My strategy are: 1.Complete NCERT for physics and chemistry.Do NCERT as fast as possible because you would gain confidence and all your concepts would be cleared. 2.Follow any objective book.After reading NCERT,solve any objective book parallel because topics would be fresh in our mind and you could solve problems with lightning speeded. 3.Make a time table and strictly follow it. 4.Stay away from distractions 5. Make a study space. 6 .Be consistent 7.Follow standard books or solve coaching material. *U can use HC Verma for physics,S L loney for Maths,K Kumar for inorganic,O P Tandon for phyiscal,MS Chauhan for organic 8.try to give tests Don't worry we can do it😊😊😊 Thank you!!!! Feel free to connect. This is my first lengthy answer. All the best. Plz forgive me, If i made any grammatical mistakes.

You are very lucky. You realized your mistake. It's not too late for you. You need to focus and review as much as you can. At the same time, if you are unable to finish whole syllabus. You can review few important topics ( straight line, circle, Conic section, basic inequality, binomial). It is major portion. Apart from this, Rest topics are included in 12th syllabus. So, if you are studying function in 12th. You can review quadratic, trigonometry one day before. If you do that, it's not going to be a difficult journey for you. Don't expect, your regret about your past is going to solve your problems. You have made mistake, now move on and focus on your study. Everything will be fine.
